reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton during Aug 2005 and loved it.

reviews.title: Friendly service but showing it's age

reviews.text: On our honeymoon and just visited Las Vegas so we were still in a high but got put down when we arrived at the Sheraton Anaheim The hotel i about an hour away from the airport and we were getting the airport bus which only comes once an hour and our luck... we just missed it so after an hours wait we boarded but the driver got us in a good mood (you have to tip everyone, shocking i know but they depend on it... apparently) we got to our hotel and it looked alright, we went to the reception desk, got to our room and were dissapointed that there were 2 double beds in the room when we were told there will be a kingsize, we phoned downstairs and were told to come back to reception, so we had to lug our luggage downstairs again to be given a key for.... you guessed it, next door to the first room, the room was exactly the same but had a kingsize huge bed which was fantastic!! the view from the room was of the courtyard. The swimming pool is o.k, gets quite busy with kids though, and what a joke with the very heated jaccuzi, whats that all about in the middle of the summer. We picked this hotel because it was halfway between sea-world and universal which takes an hour and a half to get to each location which we pre-booked back home, the location of the hotel was dreadfull, right next to the freeway, no shops nearby, no pubs, about $20 later in a cab we find ourselves in the centre of the town (near the mariot) where its all happening so we will go there next time. Staff were pretty rubbish and didnt really care about there guests. Recommending VIP TOURS which we used to go universal which was amazing day out (definetely recommend getting a "Gate A pass" to skip all the ques, only costs $48 each but well worth it, got to do and see everything, Universal, huge dissapointment, recommend for kids though and be very patient with ques, deffinetely not a place for honeymooners, went on a city tour through hollywood and L.A.. recommended. Wouldnt stay at the sheraton in Anaheim, the marriot and hilton have better shps, cafes, pubs etc.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Rubbish Location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights early July. It has seen better days, and the decor is a bit tired, but I wouldn't write it off. The rooms were spacious and kept very clean. Overall it was comfortable. The check in was very smooth, and the staff at the hotel were among the friendliest we encountered in all 7 hotels we stayed in on a touring holiday. If you are not travelling with kids, I would avoid the rooms around the pool.
reviews.title: Pleasant, but frayed around the edges

reviews.text: Hotel is close to Disney, and a shuttle bus runs every half hour. You also get a great view of the fireworks each evening (bit of a shock the first night as we had gone to bed early - still on UK time).
reviews.title: Will Not Stay Here Again
Quiet, comfortable, and convenient
reviews.text: This hotel is really only a good location if you are travelling to see Disney (which we were not). If you want to tour around LA in general it is a bit out of the way. Visited Disney village one evening, and got the impression the whole park was much smaller than Florida, and extremely crowded. Couldn't get in to eat anywhere and left after an hour.
If you are into the sights, don't miss the Getty Centre, Santa Monica, and the Queen Mary and Scorpion at Long Beach.
reviews.title: Adequate Hotel, Nothing Special

reviews.text: Convenient parking, very nice lobby area with adjacent restaurant/bar. Great service at check-in, very helpful. I asked about a restaurant and they offered to go look it up - so willing to help above and beyond.
reviews.title: Nice stay overall
Great Value and Fantastic Beds
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in my room - it was huge! I haven't seen a hotel room that large in a long time. Some parts of the room were showing age - the light fixtures on either side of the bed were worn out and hanging like they were about to fall.

reviews.title: Another jewel in the Starwood Crown
reviews.text: The bed was wonderful, the bathroom was small but nice. I had plenty of places to sit down and relax. My room overlooked the pool, but I didn't find it to be noisy at all.

My one major disappointment was the air conditioning system (or lack thereof) mentioned in previous posts. There is a note above the temp control (which is basically just a fan control) that says the entire bldg is cooled or heated to one temp - and that they hope that the temp is satisfactory to you. WHAT? I was astounded - I've never seen that before, and I stay in a lot of hotels. I was really hot when I arrived, so I was disappointed that I couldn't adjust the temperature in my room.
reviews.title: Loved it but not the security.....
One glitch vs. great stay!!!
reviews.text: I took a nap and woke up late for an evening function, so I called room service and asked them if they could rush something because I was running late (I figured that was a joke, but wouldn't hurt to ask) and they said they would try their best. It was up in about 10 minutes, with very friendly service. The food was great.

We arrived at the Sheraton Anaheim earlier than check-in time. No problem! The front desk allowed us into our room. Actually they even allowed us to choose the location! We have teenagers, the pool area would be perfect for us. Again, no problem! Our outside door opened at the pool gate. Perfect for us. The pool noise mentioned previously wasn't a problem for us as our kids were the ones making the noise while we were there. We could have done without the early morning pool cleanup usually before 7am.
reviews.title: Great Stay!
Great for a couple of nights
reviews.text: We ate in the Bistro for breakfast most days. The buffet looked alittle used most of the time so we ordered off the menu. There wasn't any outdoor seating which was a disappointment. It looked gorgeous out there. Room service was also fantastic and quick. The kids enjoyed not getting up with us but ordering their food on their own.
The location to Disney, in my opinion, can't be beat. The shuttle was convenient as well as timely. We never waited longer than a couple of minutes. So much easier than driving yourself and parking.
reviews.title: it's okay
Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: We totally enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Anaheim.

We stayed here for the first three nights of our driving holiday. The rooms were huge and spacious, the beds were heaven, the bathroom wasn't huge but i wasn't intending to stay in there long. My two very tall teens had bags of space. The air con is a blessing and easy to use.
reviews.title: Lovely place, close to Disney, some problems.

description: Share memories to last a lifetime at the castle-themed Sheraton Anaheim Hotel, located near the Disneyland Parks with complimentary shuttle service every 30 min to and from all the Disney attractions.
